english: name of an ancient Chinese ruler

etymology.description: 禸(禸) (róu, "track") as semantic indicating land and 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") indicating terrain + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") phonetic component = a name for a ruler famed for flood control -> name of ancient Chinese ruler
etymology.interpretation: The character 禹(yǔ) reflects the historical association with land and flood management, as indicated by the components representing earth and terrain combined with a phonetic element.

examples.chinese: 禹开创了防洪治水的先河(禹開創了防洪治水的先河)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔ kāichuàng le fánghóng zhìshuǐ de xiānhé.
examples.english: Yu pioneered flood control and water management.

examples.chinese: 禹制定了治水规划(禹制定了治水規劃)，启示后代治理水患(啟示後代治理水患)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔ zhìdìng le zhìshuǐ guīhuà, qǐshì hòudài zhìlǐ shuǐhuàn.
examples.english: Yu established water management strategies, inspiring later generations to manage floods.
